}}

Compares the underlying {{lc|std::type_info}} objects.

@1,2@ Checks whether the underlying {{lc|std::type_info}} objects refer to the same type.

@3-7@ Compares the underlying {{lc|std::type_info}} objects as defined by an implementation-defined ordering. The comparison is done by {{l2tt|cpp/types/type_info/before}}.

{{rrev|since=c++20|
{{cpp/note synthesized eq}}
}}

===Parameters===
{{par begin}}
{{par|rhs|another {{tt|type_index}} object to compare to}}
{{par end}} 

===Return value===
@1@ {{c|true}} if the underlying {{lc|std::type_info}} objects refer to the same type, {{c|false}} otherwise.

@2@ {{c|true}} if the underlying {{lc|std::type_info}} objects refer not to the same type, {{c|false}} otherwise.

@3-6@ {{c|true}} if the types referred by the underlying {{lc|std::type_info}} objects are ordered by corresponding order, {{c|false}} otherwise.

@7@ {{c|std::strong_ordering::equal}} if the underlying {{lc|std::type_info}} objects refer to the same type, otherwise {{c|std::strong_ordering::less}} if {{c|*this}}'s underlying {{lc|std::type_info}} object precedes {{c|rhs}}'s in the implementation-defined ordering, otherwise {{c|std::strong_ordering::greater}}.
